comment.author: 57122113@N04
comment._content: I am interested and had read the comments previously from [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] 's linked image. I am interested in links to images of any ships that visited Port Darwin and Cambridge Gulf (Wyndham) or King Sound (Derby) if any ship buffs out there can help?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/khs-museum] That would be like looking for proverbial needles in haystacks! I would suggest trove.nla.gov.au/ , to search local newspaper reports of ships in those ports, and then image searches on the particular ships by individual name. Good luck!

comment.author: 64403351@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/khs-museum] The Western Australian Maritime Museum might be your best bet.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Don't assume that anything they tell you is right, however,   Some maritime museums have made some spectacularly bad mistakes.

comment.author: 7892196@N02
comment._content: As the West Australian Maritime Museum is one of the leading institutions of its type in the worls they would be less likely to make  "spectacularly bad mistakes".
